document_data.name: Pink Flumph
document_data.mainbody: The '''Pink Flumph''' was a theater in the [[Waterdeep/Castle Ward|Castle Ward]] of [[Waterdeep]]. It featured plays of different genres in afternoon and evening sessions.
document_data.Structure: The theater's fa√ßade featured a sign with its name and posters advertising the featured shows.

Interior.Atmosphere: The interior of the Pink Flumph was lit by [[lantern]]s enchanted with ''[[continual flame]]'' [[spell]]s. Within the theater and backstage, the lights could be dimmed and raised via command words known to the stage managers.

document_data.Services:
Admission to any of the theater's plays cost 1 [[Shard (coin)|shard]] per person. On any given day, each performance typically drew an audience of between 20 and 200 paying customers.

In the spring of {{Yearlink|1492}},{{Waterdeep-time}} the two plays featured in the Pink Flumph were the following:
* ''[[Meet the Goodberrys]]'', an afternoon comedy about a large family of [[halfling]] criminals.
* ''[[Kiss of the Lamia]]'', an evening tragic play about a prince from [[Mulhorand]] who, after being banished to a desert and being charmed by a [[lamia]], returned home to reconquer his kingdom.
document_data.History: The theater was originally owned by [[Algondar Daliano]] and passed on to his wife [[Iokaste Daliano|Iokaste]] after his death sometime in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. Lacking her late husband's passion for theater, Iokaste saw the business as a way to interact with and gain the favor of important citizens of Waterdeep. She delegated all artistic and management decisions to the theater's directors.
document_data.Inhabitants:
The violet [[faerie dragon]] [[Wishes]] was originally Algondar's companion and continued working in the theater following his death. The dragon used its magic to provide special effects for the plays and donated all its earnings to Waterdhavians in need, by flying throughout the city while invisible and leaving coins at different locations.

As of the late 15{{th}} century DR, notable performers at the Pink Flumph included the drag queen [[Chaotic Eva]], the [[bard]] [[Florizan Blank]], and the actress [[Yaliek Iltizmar]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: The Pink Flumph was one of the locations that was potentially said to conceal the entrance to the [[Vault of Dragons]].
